reasoning: Carcinoma of unknown primary (CUP) is one of the 10 most frequent cancers worldwide, representing 3-5% of all human malignancies. Population-based incidence rate of 4.1 per 100,000 (age-adjusted to World Segi 1960 population). CUP represents a heterogeneous group of metastatic cancers where primary tumor remains unidentified after standardized diagnostic workup. Incidence has been declining since early 1980s due to improved diagnostic techniques.
source: Pavlidis N et al. (2005). Cancer of unknown primary: biological and clinical characteristics. Ann Oncol. 16(11):1657-1666
